summary: The Supreme Court Ethics, Recusal, and Transparency Act of 2025 aims to increase transparency and accountability within the Supreme Court. The bill mandates a code of conduct for Supreme Court justices, establishes procedures for filing and investigating complaints against justices, sets minimum gift and disclosure standards, clarifies circumstances requiring disqualification, provides for the review of disqualification motions, and requires disclosure by parties and amici. It also directs studies and reports on compliance with judicial ethics and requires audits of amicus disclosures.
